courses.course_title: Build Beautiful Cross-Platform Apps with Flutter
guidelines: Participants must have access to a computer (Windows/Linux/Mac) with internet connectivity.
No prior experience required — this course starts from the basics.
Students must commit at least 6–8 hours per week for study and practice.
Assignments will be given every week and must be submitted on time.
Respect peer feedback and collaborate during group sessions.
A final capstone project must be completed to earn the certificate.

courses.course_title: Full-Stack Web Development – From HTML to Deployment
guidelines: No prior experience required — this course starts from the basics.
Students must commit at least 6–8 hours per week for study and practice.
All sessions will be recorded and shared for later viewing.
Weekly quizzes and coding tasks are part of the learning path.
Final portfolio website must be submitted for certification.
Collaboration and respectful behavior in the student community are mandatory.

courses.course_title: Complete Digital Marketing Course – SEO, Social Media & Ads Mastery
guidelines: No prior marketing experience needed – beginners are welcome.
Students must create a Gmail account for accessing Google tools.
Weekly practical tasks must be submitted to continue to the next module.
A laptop or desktop is required for effective learning.
Final project includes creating a digital marketing campaign for a real or mock business.
Certification will be provided only upon full completion and project submission.

courses.course_title: Professional Graphic Design Course – From Basics to Branding
guidelines: No prior design experience is required — course starts from scratch.
Students must have access to a PC or laptop with design software installed.
Regular practice and project submission are key to progress.
Course includes real-world client-based design tasks.
Final portfolio submission is required for certification.
Respect creative feedback and participate actively in peer reviews.

courses.course_title: Become a UI/UX Designer – From User Research to Interactive Design
guidelines: No prior design experience is required — course starts with foundational concepts.
Participants must have access to a laptop or desktop with design software installed.
Active participation in design critique sessions and peer feedback is required.
Weekly design exercises and challenges must be completed to develop practical skills.
Final project includes creating a complete UI/UX design for a real or mock app/website.
Students are encouraged to create a portfolio for future job opportunities.

courses.course_title: Master Cyber Security – Protecting Systems and Data from Threats
guidelines: Basic understanding of computer networks is recommended but not required.
Participants must have access to a computer with a stable internet connection.
Ethical hacking tools will be used in a controlled and legal environment.
Weekly quizzes, assignments, and virtual labs are part of the learning process.
Final project includes simulating a real-world cyber attack and defense.
Adherence to ethical guidelines is mandatory.
